the uncomfortable or distressful feeling caused by a desire or need for water and characterised generally by a sensation of dryness in the mouth and throat; thirst.
a holder of vast mass of water; the ocean.

of, living in or produced by the ocean.
a wave on the surface of sea-water.
a small receptacle of water; a pond or lake.
a drop of water.
excessive arrogance; one's pride that is unbearable to others.

a coming forth; a coming into existence; birth.
the act or an instance of appearing; appearance.
the actual or refracted appearance of a heavenly body, as the sun, moon, etc. above the horizon; apparition.
an advance in social status, rank, importance, etc.
the appearance of a fish at the wateṛs surface.
advantage; gain; benefit.
income; revenue.
(Jain.) a division of time; the period in which the consequences is to borne.
(pros.) a meter.
ಉದಯವಾಗು udayavāgu 1. (the sun, moon, stars etc.) to appear to have risen; 2. to begin to be day; to dawn; 3. to begin to appear or develop; to come forth; 4. to progress economically, culturally.
(the sun, moon, stars etc.) to appear to have risen.
to be born; to come into existence.
the first or early part of the day; the time in the morning when daylight first appears; daybreak.
= ಉದಯಗಿರಿ.
the eastern mountain behind which the sun, moon, and stars appear to rise from.

a mythological palm tree that is believed to sprout at the time of sun-rise, and grow to its full height by mid-day and disappears with the sun in the evening.
rising; coming forth; being in the initial stage of development.
the time and the instance of sun-rise in the morning.
that is being born.
rising; developing; growing.
the rising sun; the morning-sun.
a musical mode derived from the main mode Naṭhabhairavi.
the light of the morning-sun.
a musical mode in Karnāṭaka system, having five notes in both ascending and descending orders, derived from the main mode Naṭhabhairavi.
the splendid red or reddish light refracted at the time of sun-rise.
any of the musical modes (esp. in Hindustani system, and rarely in Karnāṭaka system) to be sung in the early part of the day.
the favourable inclination of the mind; affection.

rising; coming forth; being in the initial stage of development.

(the sun, moon, etc.) to appear above the horizon.
to appear; to become noticed.
to come forth; to be born; to come into existence.
being in the early stage of development; showing the tendency to develop or improve; coming out of dormant stage to a growing stage.
the lower front part of the human body between the chest and thighs; the belly.

the stomach - a) the large, saclike organ of vertebrates into which food passes from the oesophagus or gullet for storage while undergoing the early processes of digestion; b) any of the separate sections of such a digestive organ, as in ruminants or all these sections collectively; c) any enlarged storage portion of the digestive cavity, as in invertebrates.
the interior or inside of anything.
ಉದರ ನಿಮಿತ್ತಂ ಬಹುಕೃತ ವೇಷಂ udara nimittam bhukřta vēṣam (prov.) all one does is to fill the belly; the belly teaches all arts.
the feeding of the belly, supporting the life.
a labouring for one's sustenance (only, ignoring the earning of knowledge, etc.); mundane-mindedness.
a selfish attitude of taking care of one's own sustenance, with no thought of the needs or welfare of others.
an instrument introduced surgically into the abdomen for examining the abdominal or pelvic organs, used in diagnosis, female sterilization, etc.; a laparoscope.
the act or process of stimulating one's natural desire for food.
that (usu. a medicinal powder) which stimulates one's appetite; an appetizer.
= ಉದರಂಭರಣ.
= ಉದರಂಭರಣ.
any of molluscs of the Gastropoda class having one-piece, straight or spiral shells, as snails, limpets, etc. or having no shells or greatly reduced shells, as certain slugs; gastropod.
to the full capacity of one's belly.
the quantity (of food) that would suffice one's belly.
= ಉದರಂಭರಿ.
